post_text:
Friday, September 11th, the following grades will be added In Person! We are excited to see the students today!!!! üñ§üíõ

Kindergarten and Pre-Kindergarten

6th Grade

10th Grade

Elementary parents will not be able to walk their children to class. However, we will take first day pictures in classes of our elementary students.



REMOTE LEARNING

Middle School and High School will go completely synchronous (real time), with an asynchronous (recorded) option to those who could not connect, or lost connection, during the assigned class time. High School and Middle School students are expected to attend all classes at the time noted on their individual class schedules. The grading and attendance policies will be as stated in the Student Handbook.

Elementary students will continue in an asynchronous (recorded) format. The grading and attendance policies will continue as stated in the Student Handbook.

post_text:
Telephone Issues

**Update: Telephones at Danbury Elementary School are now working. **
Telephones are down at Danbury Elementary School at this time following two power surges that occurred this morning. We are currently working to resolve the issue. Please contact staff by email if possible. If needed, contact Danbury Administration Office at (979) 922-1218.

DISD has been experiencing issues with district telephones for several weeks. ATT is working to resolve the issue as we are told that the problem is with ATT switching equipment. The issues exist throughout the area which includes Angleton. Problems include calls being dropped, busy signals, and static.

The issues exist throughout the area which includes Angleton. Problems include calls being dropped, busy signals, and static.

A message from DANBURY ISD

Danbury ISD is suspending ALL football activities for the next 14 (fourteen) days due to one of our football coaches receiving a lab confirmed case of COVID-19. Tonight‚Äôs football game is canceled.

All football staff and players should self-quarantine for the next 14 days and be alert for symptoms of the coronavirus. These actions are being taken in accordance with the latest U.I.L., T.E.A., State and local guidance.

Please remember face coverings, social distancing and frequent handwashing.

All football staff and players should self-quarantine for the next 14 days and be alert for symptoms of the coronavirus. These actions are being taken in accordance with the latest U.I.L., T.E.A., State and local guidance.

Please remember face coverings, social distancing and frequent handwashing.

post_text:
DISD Closing Information

Due to Tropical Storm Laura in the Gulf of Mexico, we have determined it is in the best interest of our students and staff to take action and close schools today, Tuesday, August 25th, at noon. We will remain closed through the end of the week. The path of this storm has changed several times over the last few days and is anticipated to strengthen. We encourage everyone to take precautions and use this time to prepare for the potential heavy winds and rain that may impact our area.

There will be no classes for virtual at-home learners on these closure dates. We will continue monitoring the Gulf of Mexico and inform parents and staff of any additional closures depending on the impact to our area, through our blackboard system, DISD social media and area news stations. Thank you and stay safe!
text:
DISD Closing Information

Due to Tropical Storm Laura in the Gulf of Mexico, we have determined it is in the best interest of our students and staff to take action and close schools today, Tuesday, August 25th, at noon. We will remain closed through the end of the week. The path of this storm has changed several times over the last few days and is anticipated to strengthen. We encourage everyone to take precautions and use this time to prepare for the potential heavy winds and rain that may impact our area.

There will be no classes for virtual at-home learners on these closure dates. We will continue monitoring the Gulf of Mexico and inform parents and staff of any additional closures depending on the impact to our area, through our blackboard system, DISD social media and area news stations. Thank you and stay safe!

post_text:
Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. Eligible P-EBT families will receive application instructions from schools in late May. The P-EBT application will open the first week of June.

P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020 and children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year. For more information, visit http://hhs.texas.gov/pebt or call 833-613-6220.

post_text:
USDA ‚Äì Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT)

The online application for the Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is now open for eligible families.

P-EBT is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. P-EBT is for families who meet at least one of the following criteria:

Children up to 21-years old who are certified for free or reduced-price meals at school in Texas during the 2019-2020 school year.

Children who attend a school that offers free meals to all students.

Children ages 5-18 who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020.

For more information, visit: hhs.texas.gov/PEBT or call 833-613-6220.
text:
USDA ‚Äì Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT)

P-EBT is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. P-EBT is for families who meet at least one of the following criteria:

Children up to 21-years old who are certified for free or reduced-price meals at school in Texas during the 2019-2020 school year.

Children who attend a school that offers free meals to all students.

Children ages 5-18 who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020.

For more information, visit: hhs.texas.gov/PEBT or call 833-613-6220.

post_text: Launch Countdown today for Liftoff! Watch it!
shared_text:
NASA - National Aeronautics and Space Administration was live.
May 30 at 10:00 AM ¬∑

Watch history unfold on Saturday, May 30, as NASA and SpaceX launch astronauts Robert Behnken and Douglas Hurley to the International Space Station. This mission marks the first time since the retirement of the space shuttle in 2011 that humans will fly to the space station from U.S. soil. The first launch attempt on May 27 was scrubbed due to weather.

Set a reminder to tune for joint NASA/SpaceX coverage starting at 11 a.m. EDT, with liftoff currently targeted for 3:22 p.m. EDT. üöÄ

The first launch attempt on May 27 was scrubbed due to weather.

post_text: Gulf Coast Auto Park wants you to nominate your favorite teacher to win a free lunch!!
shared_text:
Gulf Coast Auto Park
May 5 at 1:41 PM ¬∑

We want to give your favorite teacher a gift certificate to The Grill! Nominate your favorite teacher now! It‚Äôs easy!
1.Just send us a video through facebook messenger of you/your child telling us about your favorite teacher! Please attach a message allowing us to post your video!
2. We will post your video on our Facebook page and let your teacher know that you have chosen them for a free lunch at The Grill!

post_text:
Happening Monday, May 4, 2020

Distribution Time: 9:30 a.m. until 11:30 a.m

The Houston Food Bank will once again provide a Mobile Food Pantry to families of Danbury ISD and Danbury ISD Senior Citizens. ID will be required to show proof of residency within Danbury ISD. This is a drive-through event.

Location: Band Hall behind Danbury Elementary School

Directions: From 5th Street turn on to Avenue F. Turn right on to Third Street. Left on to gravel road (Avenue G). ID will be checked at this point. MUST BE RESIDENT OF DANBURY ISD. Items will be distributed at Band Hall location. Exit at 1st Street. These directions must be followed as written.

If you have questions, please contact Disa Schulze, Director of Support Services, at Disa.Schulze@danburyisd.org.

post_text:
UIL Cancels All Remaining Spring Activities and State Championships

With the announcement from Governor Greg Abbott that all Texas schools are to remain closed to in-person learning for the remainder of this school year, and in an effort to help protect the health and safety of Texans, the University Interscholastic League (UIL) is canceling all remaining 2019-2020 spring activities and state championships.
text:
UIL Cancels All Remaining Spring Activities and State Championships

With the announcement from Governor Greg Abbott that all Texas schools are to remain closed to in-person learning for the remainder of this school year, and in an effort to help protect the health and safety of Texans, the University Interscholastic League (UIL) is canceling all remaining 2019-2020 spring activities and state championships.

post_text: Common symptoms of COVID-19 are fever, dry cough, & shortness of breath. If you have mild symptoms, call your doctor & #StayHome. If you develop serious symptoms, such as trouble breathing, pressure in the chest, or bluish lips or face, call your doctor & seek care immediately.
text: Common symptoms of COVID-19 are fever, dry cough, & shortness of breath. If you have mild symptoms, call your doctor & #StayHome. If you develop serious symptoms, such as trouble breathing, pressure in the chest, or bluish lips or face, call your doctor & seek care immediately.

ATTENTION TX PARENTS

TEA released a new Texas Home Learning website with great remote learning resources as we continue to weather the #COVID19 pandemic in our homes. Learn as a family, take virtual field trips, keep kids curious and engaged through the right interest-based opportunity for your child, get support during this stressful time, implement early learning strategies for your younger child, and more!

Find all of these resources at https://house.texas.gov/_media/pdf/Resources-for-Parents.pdf
#txlege #StayHomeTexas

post_text:
Angleton ISD Child Nutrition Department will offer a free meal to ALL children 18 or younger, including Danbury ISD children.

Meal Service Plan ‚Äì Updated Bus Routes and Curbside Pickup Information

Danbury ISD Child Nutrition Department is federally funded and regulated. For information about this funding through USDA and TDA go to www.squaremeals.org

Because DISD does not meet the criteria required to provide meals to our students with federal funds, we are working together with Angleton ISD.

Angleton ISD Child Nutrition Department will offer a free meal to ALL children 18 or younger, including Danbury ISD children. Child(ren) must be present when meals are picked up. They have added another route to their schedule. Please see the attached schedule for the adjusted bus routes and information regarding curbside service.

If you have questions, please contact Disa Schulze at Disa.Schulze@danburyisd.org or Lisa Menard at Lisa.Menard@danburyisd.org.
